response:
In a 36-year-old patient with subacute onset monocular visual loss, inflammatory/demyelinating causes are the primary concern. Atypical optic neuritis and hereditary causes are important differentials in this demographic.

differential_diagnosis = ["Optic Neuritis (associated with Multiple Sclerosis)", "MOG-antibody associated disease (MOGAD)", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "Leber's Hereditary Optic Neuropathy (LHON)", "Infectious Optic Neuropathy (e.g., Syphilis, Lyme, Bartonella)", "Compressive Optic Neuropathy (e.g., Optic nerve sheath meningioma)", "Ischaemic Optic Neuropathy", "Sarcoidosis"]
